info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:29AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Lincoln, northwestern Mecklenburg, east central Cleveland and Gaston Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 528 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Gastonia, or near Bessemer City, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Huntersville, Kings Mountain, Mt Holly, Bessemer City, Dallas, Stanley, Lowell, Ranlo and Westport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
